member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Trace
member.summary: Provides a set of methods and properties that help you trace the execution of your code. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Trace.Assert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks for a condition; if the condition is false, displays a message box that shows the call stack.
member.param: The conditional expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, a failure message is not sent and the message box is not displayed.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Trace.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for a condition; if the condition is false, outputs a specified message and displays a message box that shows the call stack.
member.param: The conditional expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the specified message is not sent and the message box is not displayed.
The message to send to the collection.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Trace.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for a condition; if the condition is false, outputs two specified messages and displays a message box that shows the call stack.
member.param: The conditional expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the specified messages are not sent and the message box is not displayed.
The message to send to the collection.
The detailed message to send to the collection.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Trace.AutoFlush

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the call stack for the current thread.
member.returns: A string containing stack trace information. This value can be an empty string ("").

member.summary: Gets the date and time at which the event trace occurred.
member.returns: A structure whose value is a date and time expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.LogicalOperationStack
member.summary: Gets the correlation data, contained in a stack.
member.returns: A containing correlation data.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.ProcessId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the current process.
member.returns: The system-generated unique identifier of the current process.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.ThreadId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the current managed thread.
member.returns: A string that represents a unique integer identifier for this managed thread.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets the current number of ticks in the timer mechanism.
member.returns: The tick counter value of the underlying timer mechanism.

member.summary: Fatal error or application crash.

member.summary: Recoverable error.

member.summary: Informational message.

member.summary: Resumption of a logical operation.

member.summary: Starting of a logical operation.

member.summary: Stopping of a logical operation.

member.summary: Suspension of a logical operation.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Transfer
member.summary: Changing of correlation identity.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Verbose
member.summary: Debugging trace.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Warning
member.summary: Noncritical problem.

One of the values specifying the type of event that has caused the trace.

Either the format to use for writing an array of arguments specified by the args parameter, or a message to write.

member.summary: Output error-handling messages.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel.Info
member.summary: Output informational messages, warnings, and error-handling messages.

member.summary: Output no tracing and debugging messages.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Output all debugging and tracing messages.

member.summary: Output warnings and error-handling messages.
